title: Mechanical Engineering PYQ (ME)
description: Comprehensive GATE Mechanical Engineering assessment covering General Aptitude and Core Mechanical Engineering subjects. This assessment includes 10 aptitude questions (15% weight) and 55 core mechanical engineering questions (85% weight) following the official GATE pattern.
whatIsDescription: GATE (Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering) Mechanical Engineering is a national-level examination that primarily tests the comprehensive understanding of various undergraduate subjects in mechanical engineering including Thermodynamics, Fluid Mechanics, Heat Transfer, Manufacturing, Machine Design, and Engineering Mathematics. This assessment follows the official GATE pattern with General Aptitude and Core Mechanical Engineering questions.

typicalCareers.title: Mechanical Engineer
typicalCareers.description: Design and develop mechanical systems and components

typicalCareers.title: Design Engineer
typicalCareers.description: Create and optimize mechanical designs for various applications

typicalCareers.title: Manufacturing Engineer
typicalCareers.description: Oversee production processes and manufacturing operations

whoShouldConsider: Mechanical Engineering graduates preparing for GATE
Students seeking admission to M.Tech/M.E programs in mechanical engineering
Professionals looking for PSU jobs in mechanical engineering
Engineers in automotive, aerospace, and manufacturing industries
idealTraits: Solid foundation in mechanical engineering principles
Good understanding of thermodynamics and fluid mechanics

modules: Core Mechanical Engineering Assessment (55 questions, 85 marks)

aptitude.title: General Aptitude Assessment
aptitude.description: Test your general aptitude including verbal ability, quantitative aptitude, and analytical reasoning skills. This section carries 15% weight in the total assessment.

questions.text: The price of an item is increased by 10% and then decreased by 10%. The net change in price is:
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude - Percentage
questions.explanation: Let the original price be P. Increase by 10%: P(1.1). Decrease by 10%: P(1.1)(0.9) = P(0.99). The net change is a 100-99=1% decrease.

questions.text: The ratio of the speed of a boat in still water to the speed of the current is 5:1. If the boat travels a certain distance downstream in 3 hours, what is the time taken to travel the same distance upstream?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude - Time & Distance
questions.explanation: Let speed of boat be 5x and current be x. Downstream speed = 6x. Upstream speed = 4x. Distance D = 6x × 3 = 18x. Upstream time T = D / 4x = 18x / 4x = 4.5 hours.

questions.text: Choose the most appropriate word from the options given below to complete the following sentence: The candidate's statement was a ___ of truth.
questions.subject: Verbal Ability - Vocabulary
questions.explanation: A 'travesty of truth' means a grotesque misrepresentation or distortion of the truth. 'Dearth' means scarcity, which does not fit the context.

questions.text: Find the next term in the series: 3, 7, 13, 21, 31, ...
questions.subject: Analytical Reasoning - Number Series
questions.explanation: The differences between consecutive terms are 4, 6, 8, 10. The next difference should be 12. Thus, 31 + 12 = 43.

questions.text: If f(x) = |x-2| + |x-5|, the minimum value of f(x) is:
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude - Calculus/Functions
questions.explanation: The function f(x) represents the sum of distances from x to 2 and x to 5. The minimum value occurs for x between 2 and 5, where f(x) = (x-2) + (5-x) = 3.

questions.text: A clock shows 4:30. What is the angle between the hour and minute hands?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude - Clocks/Geometry

questions.text: The synonym for 'Mellifluous' is:
questions.subject: Verbal Ability - Vocabulary (Synonyms)
questions.explanation: 'Mellifluous' means a sound that is sweet and musical; pleasant to hear. 'Harmonious' is the closest synonym.

questions.text: In a group, 70% of the students speak English and 50% speak Hindi. If 40 students speak both, what is the total number of students in the group?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude - Set Theory
questions.explanation: Percentage speaking both = (70% + 50%) - 100% = 20%. If 20% of total X is 40, then 0.20 × X = 40, so X = 200.

questions.text: The pair of words that best expresses a similar relationship as 'Surgeon : Scalpel' is:
questions.subject: Verbal Ability - Analogy
questions.explanation: The relationship is 'Person : Primary Tool'. A Surgeon uses a Scalpel; a Sculptor uses a Chisel.

questions.text: A sum of money doubles in 5 years at simple interest. In how many years will it become four times?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude - Simple Interest
questions.explanation: To double, Interest (I) must be 1P, taking 5 years. To become four times, I must be 3P. Since simple interest is linear, it takes 3 × 5 = 15 years.

core.title: Core Mechanical Engineering Assessment
core.description: Comprehensive assessment covering Thermodynamics, Fluid Mechanics, Heat Transfer, Manufacturing, Machine Design, and Engineering Mathematics. This section carries 85% weight in the total assessment.

questions.text: The work done in a free expansion process for an ideal gas is:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics
questions.explanation: A free expansion is an irreversible, uncontrolled process where the gas expands into a vacuum. Since there is no external resistance and the boundary does not move against any force, the displacement work done is zero.

questions.text: The property of a material that enables it to absorb energy without permanent deformation is called:
questions.subject: Engineering Materials
questions.explanation: Resilience is the ability of a material to absorb energy when deformed elastically (i.e., strain energy up to the elastic limit) and release that energy upon unloading. Toughness refers to energy absorbed up to fracture.

questions.text: The maximum shear stress theory (Tresca) is best suited for predicting the failure of materials that are:
questions.subject: Machine Design
questions.explanation: The maximum shear stress theory (Tresca) is one of the two most commonly used failure criteria for ductile materials under static loading. The maximum normal stress theory (Rankine) is used for brittle materials.

questions.text: The continuity equation for fluid flow is based on the principle of conservation of:
questions.subject: Fluid Mechanics
questions.explanation: The continuity equation states that the mass flow rate entering a system must equal the mass flow rate leaving the system (for steady flow), thus representing the conservation of mass.

questions.text: The total number of instantaneous centers of rotation for a mechanism with N links is:
questions.subject: Theory of Machines
questions.explanation: The number of instantaneous centers (I) for an N-link mechanism is the number of possible combinations of two links, given by C(N,2) = N(N-1)/2.

questions.text: In a simply supported beam of length L subjected to a uniformly distributed load (UDL) of intensity w, the maximum bending moment is:
questions.subject: Solid Mechanics
questions.explanation: For a simply supported beam with UDL, the maximum bending moment occurs at the center and is given by M_max = wL²/8.

questions.text: The efficiency of a Carnot heat engine operating between temperatures T_H and T_L is:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics
questions.explanation: Carnot efficiency is the maximum possible efficiency, given by η = 1 - T_L/T_H (where T_L and T_H must be in Kelvin).

questions.text: The value of the definite integral ∫₀^π sin(x) dx is:
questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics - Calculus

questions.text: In a single-point cutting tool, the rake angle determines:

options.text: The strength and sharpness of the cutting edge.
The chip flow direction away from the tool flank.

questions.subject: Manufacturing - Machining
questions.explanation: The rake angle (positive or negative) controls how steep the chip flows over the rake face, primarily influencing the wedge angle and thus the strength and sharpness of the cutting tip.

questions.text: The term gauge pressure refers to pressure measured relative to:
questions.subject: Fluid Mechanics
questions.explanation: Gauge pressure is the difference between the measured pressure and the local atmospheric pressure.

questions.text: The number of degrees of freedom for a body floating in space is:
questions.subject: Theory of Machines
questions.explanation: A rigid body floating in space (a free body) can undergo three independent translations (x, y, z) and three independent rotations (roll, pitch, yaw, or rotation about x, y, z axes), totaling 6 degrees of freedom.

questions.text: The point of contraflexure (or inflection) in a beam is where the:
questions.subject: Solid Mechanics
questions.explanation: The point of contraflexure is the location along the beam where the bending moment is zero and, crucially, changes sign (from hogging to sagging or vice-versa).

questions.text: If a system absorbs 20 kJ of heat while doing 5 kJ of work, the change in its internal energy is:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics
questions.explanation: From the First Law of Thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W. Heat absorbed Q = +20 kJ. Work done by the system W = +5 kJ. ΔU = 20 - 5 = 15 kJ.

questions.text: The primary objective of risers in sand casting is to:
questions.subject: Manufacturing - Casting
questions.explanation: Risers are reservoirs of molten metal that feed the casting as it cools and shrinks, compensating for solidification shrinkage to prevent voids (porosity).

questions.text: The relationship between Young's Modulus (E), Bulk Modulus (K), and Poisson's ratio (ν) is:
questions.subject: Solid Mechanics
questions.explanation: This is one of the fundamental relationships connecting the elastic constants: E = 3K(1-2ν). (Note: The relationship E = 2G(1+ν) is also correct, but B is given as the answer choice.)

questions.text: The degree of reaction in a turbo-machine is defined as the ratio of isentropic enthalpy drop in the rotor to the isentropic enthalpy drop in the stage.
questions.subject: Fluid Mechanics/Turbo-machinery
questions.explanation: The degree of reaction (R) is a ratio of enthalpy drops, so its value must be between 0 and 1. R=0 is an impulse turbine, and R=1 is a pure reaction turbine (theoretical).

questions.text: A Governor in an engine primarily regulates:
questions.subject: Theory of Machines/IC Engines
questions.explanation: The governor is a speed-regulating device that controls the amount of fuel/working fluid supplied to the engine to maintain the mean speed within prescribed limits under varying load conditions.

questions.text: The principal stresses in a 2D body are σ₁ and σ₂. The maximum shear stress is:
questions.subject: Solid Mechanics
questions.explanation: The maximum shear stress (τ_max) is equal to the radius of the Mohr's circle, which is half the difference between the principal stresses: τ_max = (σ₁ - σ₂)/2.

questions.text: The Rankine cycle consists of which four processes?
questions.subject: Thermodynamics/Power Cycles
questions.explanation: The Rankine cycle involves: 1-2: Isentropic Pumping, 2-3: Isobaric Heat Addition, 3-4: Isentropic Expansion (Turbine), 4-1: Isobaric Heat Rejection.

questions.text: The Euler equation of motion for fluid flow is based on the assumption of:
questions.subject: Fluid Mechanics
questions.explanation: The Euler equation is a form of the momentum equation for fluid flow that assumes the fluid is inviscid (non-viscous), incompressible, and steady.

questions.text: The limit of size (or nominal size) in metrology refers to the:
questions.subject: Manufacturing/Metrology
questions.explanation: The limits of size are the upper and lower permissible values of a dimension, defining the tolerance zone.

questions.text: The general solution to the differential equation d²y/dx² + y = 0 is:
questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics - Differential Equations
questions.explanation: The auxiliary equation is m² + 1 = 0, giving roots m = ±j. The general solution is y(x) = C₁ cos(x) + C₂ sin(x).

questions.text: In a four-stroke SI engine, the intake valve opens:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics/IC Engines
questions.explanation: To utilize the inertia of the incoming charge and ensure complete cylinder scavenging, the intake valve typically opens slightly Before TDC of the suction stroke.

questions.text: The modulus of resilience for a material is represented by the area under the stress-strain curve up to the:
questions.subject: Engineering Materials/Solid Mechanics
questions.explanation: The modulus of resilience is the strain energy per unit volume stored in the material when stressed up to the yield point (or elastic limit).

questions.text: The Taylor tool life equation relates cutting speed (V) and tool life (T) as:
questions.subject: Manufacturing - Machining
questions.explanation: The Taylor tool life equation is an empirical relationship: VT^n = C, where n is the Taylor exponent and C is a constant.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of a lower pair in kinematic joints?
questions.subject: Theory of Machines
questions.explanation: A lower pair has surface contact between the elements (e.g., pin joint, sliding joint, ball and socket joint). Higher pairs have point or line contact (e.g., cam and follower, gear teeth).

questions.text: The shear center of a structural section is the point through which the applied shear force causes:
questions.subject: Solid Mechanics/Machine Design
questions.explanation: The shear center is a point where the shear force can be applied without causing any torsional deformation (twisting) of the cross-section.

questions.text: If a gas is compressed adiabatically, its temperature:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics
questions.explanation: In adiabatic compression (Q=0), work is done on the gas (W is negative). By the First Law (ΔU = Q - W), the internal energy ΔU increases, leading to an increase in temperature.

questions.text: The Reynolds number is a dimensionless parameter that represents the ratio of:
questions.subject: Fluid Mechanics
questions.explanation: Reynolds number (Re) is Inertia force / Viscous force. It is used to predict flow patterns in different fluid flow situations (laminar vs. turbulent).

questions.text: For a 3×3 matrix A, if det(A)=5, then the determinant of 2A is:
questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics - Linear Algebra
questions.explanation: The property is det(kA) = k^n det(A), where n is the size of the matrix. Here, n=3 and k=2. det(2A) = 2³ det(A) = 8 × 5 = 40.

questions.text: The primary objective of economic batch quantity (EBQ) is to minimize:
questions.subject: Industrial Engineering
questions.explanation: EBQ (or EPQ) is an inventory model that determines the optimal batch size to minimize the sum of setup cost and inventory holding cost per unit time.

questions.text: In a belt drive system, creep is due to:
questions.subject: Theory of Machines
questions.explanation: Creep is the relative motion between the belt and pulley surface caused by the elastic stretching and contracting of the belt as it moves from the tight side to the slack side (and vice-versa).

questions.text: The specific speed of a hydraulic turbine is used to:

options.text: Determine the size of the turbine.

questions.subject: Fluid Mechanics/Turbo-machinery
questions.explanation: The specific speed (N_s) is the most important parameter used to classify the type of turbine (e.g., Pelton, Francis, Kaplan) suitable for a given head and flow rate.

questions.text: The condition for a screw jack to be self-locking is:

options.text: Helix angle (α) is greater than friction angle (φ).
Helix angle (α) is less than friction angle (φ).

questions.subject: Machine Design
questions.explanation: A screw is self-locking if the friction torque is greater than the unwinding torque. This occurs when the helix angle (α) is less than the friction angle (φ).

questions.text: In a gas turbine power plant, the two processes that involve heat transfer are:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics/Power Cycles
questions.explanation: A gas turbine (Brayton) cycle involves: Isentropic Compression, Isobaric Heat Addition (Combustion), Isentropic Expansion, and Isobaric Heat Rejection (to atmosphere/cooler).

questions.text: The coefficient of performance (COP) of a refrigerator operating between T_L and T_H is given by:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics/Refrigeration
questions.explanation: The COP_Ref is the desired output (heat removed from T_L) divided by the required input (work): COP_Ref = Q_L/W_net = T_L/(T_H - T_L).

questions.text: The modulus of rigidity (G) is also known as:
questions.subject: Solid Mechanics
questions.explanation: The modulus of rigidity (G) relates shear stress to shear strain and is therefore also known as the shear modulus.

questions.text: The minimum number of independent coordinates required to define the position of all parts of a mechanism is known as the:
questions.subject: Theory of Machines
questions.explanation: The degree of freedom (mobility) is the number of independent input parameters (coordinates) required to completely define the position and orientation of a system.

questions.text: Which manufacturing process utilizes a non-consumable electrode and an inert gas shield?
questions.subject: Manufacturing - Welding
questions.explanation: Gas Tungsten Arc Welding (GTAW or TIG) uses a non-consumable Tungsten electrode and relies on an external shielding gas (often Argon) to protect the weld area.

questions.text: The First Law of Thermodynamics deals with:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics
questions.explanation: The First Law of Thermodynamics is the statement of the conservation of energy, which relates heat, work, and internal energy change (ΔU = Q - W).

questions.text: If A and B are non-zero vectors, and their dot product A · B = 0, then the vectors are:
questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics - Vector Algebra
questions.explanation: Since A · B = |A| |B| cos(θ), and |A| ≠ 0, |B| ≠ 0, A · B = 0 implies cos(θ)=0, so θ = 90°. The vectors are orthogonal.

questions.text: The maximum stress in a shaft subjected to pure torsion occurs at the:

options.text: Area where the diameter is maximum.

questions.subject: Solid Mechanics
questions.explanation: The shear stress due to torsion (τ = Tr/J) is linearly proportional to the radius (r). Therefore, the maximum shear stress occurs at the maximum radius, which is the outer surface of the shaft.

questions.text: The purpose of providing a counter-weight in a single-cylinder reciprocating engine is to:

options.text: Balance the primary reciprocating forces only.
Balance the secondary reciprocating forces only.
Partially balance the primary reciprocating forces.

questions.subject: Theory of Machines
questions.explanation: A counter-weight is placed opposite the crank to partially balance the primary reciprocating forces. Complete balancing is impossible, as it would introduce an undesirable vertical secondary unbalanced force.

questions.text: The Green Sand mold is mainly characterized by its:

options.text: Use of clay and water as binders.

questions.subject: Manufacturing - Casting
questions.explanation: Green sand is a mixture of silica sand, clay (bentonite), and water. It is used in the moist or 'green' condition, with clay and water acting as the natural binders.

questions.text: The heat transfer mechanism that involves the movement of a fluid is:
questions.subject: Heat Transfer
questions.explanation: Convection is the transfer of heat by the bulk movement of fluid (liquid or gas). Conduction and radiation do not require bulk motion.

questions.text: If A is a singular matrix, then det(A) is:
questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics - Linear Algebra
questions.explanation: A square matrix A is defined as singular if its determinant is zero. A singular matrix does not have an inverse.

questions.text: The primary function of a clutch in a power transmission system is to:

options.text: Change the speed of the output shaft.
Engage or disengage the drive between the engine and transmission.

questions.subject: Machine Design
questions.explanation: A clutch is a mechanical device used to connect (engage) or disconnect (disengage) two rotating shafts (e.g., engine and gearbox) at will.

questions.text: The thermal diffusivity (α) of a material is given by:
questions.subject: Heat Transfer
questions.explanation: Thermal diffusivity (α) is a measure of how quickly a material heats up or cools down. It is defined as k / (ρ c_p), where k is thermal conductivity, ρ is density, and c_p is specific heat capacity.

questions.text: The maximum deflection of a cantilever beam of length L subjected to a point load P at the free end is proportional to:
questions.subject: Solid Mechanics
questions.explanation: The maximum deflection is y_max = PL³/(3EI). Since P, E, I are constants, y_max ∝ L³.

questions.text: The most common lubricant used in metal cutting to act as both a coolant and a lubricant is:
questions.subject: Manufacturing - Machining
questions.explanation: Soluble oil (an oil-in-water emulsion) is the most widely used cutting fluid. The water provides cooling, and the oil provides lubrication.

questions.text: The velocity of sound in an ideal gas is proportional to:

options.text: The square root of the absolute temperature (√T)
The square of the absolute temperature (T²)

questions.subject: Thermodynamics/Fluid Mechanics
questions.explanation: The speed of sound c = √(γ R T), where γ and R are constants for a given gas. Thus, c is directly proportional to the square root of the absolute temperature (√T).

questions.text: In PERT (Program Evaluation and Review Technique), the activity duration is based on three time estimates:
questions.subject: Industrial Engineering
questions.explanation: PERT uses a probabilistic approach where activity duration is estimated using the optimistic (t_o), pessimistic (t_p), and most likely (t_m) times.

questions.text: For a rolling contact bearing, the static load carrying capacity refers to:

options.text: The load sustained for one million revolutions.
The load sustained without plastic deformation.

questions.subject: Machine Design
questions.explanation: The static load carrying capacity (C_0) is the load that causes a permanent plastic deformation of 0.0001 times the rolling element diameter at the most heavily stressed contact point.

questions.text: The eigenvalues of a symmetric matrix with real elements are always:
questions.subject: Engineering Mathematics - Linear Algebra
questions.explanation: A fundamental property of symmetric matrices (where A=A^T) with real elements is that all of their eigenvalues are real.

questions.text: The thermal boundary layer thickness (δ_T) and hydrodynamic boundary layer thickness (δ) are related by the:
questions.subject: Heat Transfer/Fluid Mechanics
questions.explanation: The relationship is δ/δ_T ≈ Pr^(1/3). The Prandtl number (Pr = ν/α) is a dimensionless group that governs the relative thickness of the thermal and hydrodynamic boundary layers.

results.title: GATE Assessment Results
results.description: Your comprehensive GATE Mechanical Engineering assessment results with detailed analysis and recommendations for improvement.
